name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station

reviews.text: Could not fault this hotel at all. We paid a small price for a room upgrade and it was certainly worth it. Great view of the canal and city, free breakfast which was amazing and had every possible breakfast food you could wish for. Staff were very efficient and helpful. Location was perfect. Would definitely stay here again and I recommend Amsterdam as a holiday destination for all ages.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Doubletree for one night prior to boarding a riverboat moored nearby. The hotel was a convenient walk from the Centraal Train Station. The sky lounge was very nice, and the included breakfast in the morning was excellent (it's not always included with your room). However, we had to call in an engineer to help us in our tiny room when we first arrive, since the shower door wouldn't open, and the complimentary computer monitor wouldn't work. Whoever built this hotel tried to be very techno, with a shower door hinged like no other that I have seen, and requiring strength and ingenuity to open. I also noted that placement of lights over the sink put you in perfect shade for shaving!
reviews.title: Convenient Location but Unusual Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review has been a long time in coming. I stayed at the Doubletree as the first stop on my European soujourn at the end of 2012. Stayed a total of 7 nights, and made day trips out to Rotterdam, Den Haag, Maastricht (about 2-3 hours away) and Haarlem.
reviews.title: Love that cookie. Good experience.

reviews.text: Easy enough to drag our luggage onto the train from Skipol, and get off and Central station and drag the suitcases 5-10mins to the hotel. And there is a resident Starbucks on premises.
reviews.title: Fine hotel

reviews.text: Everyone talks about the warm choc chip cookie they gave on check-in, and it's a wonderful cookie (I hope they still do). Very soothing, esp after a long flight.
reviews.title: Customer Service at it's Best!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a newish hotel close to Centraal station so very convenient for those arriving by train/Schiphol. As you come out of the station turn left and walk towards the large floating Chinese restaurant. The hotel is on the left. Make sure you only have light luggage as it’s a real trek in the cold (snowy/wet) weather – no cover available and quite unpleasant walking into the rain/wind. You also have to cross a road and some bicycle/tram routes so be aware of traffic.
reviews.title: Not sure this hotel lives up to the hype?

reviews.text: Nice welcome from reception – a very modern lobby, stylish and quite upscale. The Hhonors welcome line gets you checked in very quickly. I’d picked a “KING DELUXE ROOM FREE WIFI, APPLE IMAC, KING BED AIR CONDITIONING, WALK IN SHOWER - Full breakfast” rate available via British Airways. I wasn’t offered a room upgrade at check in.
reviews.title: Great Room With a View

reviews.text: The room was probably the smallest room I’ve ever stayed in at a Hilton of any sort. It was also the smallest King bed I’ve ever seen (I’ve seen larger queen beds when staying in the USA) There was a large picture window which looked out over the harbour so at least made the room seem more spacious. Everything was well designed to fit the small space – tiny wardrobe, small table and chair, small desk and an Apple iMAC smart TV. Lighting was adequate but it’s not a place to spend any amount of time in (wouldn’t want to work at the desk for a long period – too cramped which is surprising for a business hotel) The room safe is at the bottom of the wardrobe – you have to be fairly flexible to reach it if you need it. The bathroom is tiny – not much storage space but the shower was good and it had everything you need (nice stone tiles & huge mirror too) It was clean too.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay in a fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given how new the hotel is, I was surprised to see the amount of scuff marks on the room walls – they need to start cleaning these off before it looks too scruffy.
reviews.title: Good hotel in great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is served on the ground floor – huge buffet selection which was great – lots of hot food and the usual continental selection for those who prefer it. Just off the restaurant is also a great bar area, very stylish and popular on a Saturday evening.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but housekeeping needs improving!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed the weekend at the Doubletree Amsterdam and were very happy with the experience. The hotel was new and clean, the room was a good size with a lovely view, the location was perfect with regard to transport to and around the city, and the breakfast was fantastic. The bars and restaurants are quite good. But most of all, I want to compliment the staff. They were the nicest, most helpful, and friendliest staff I have come across in my travels for a long time. They were the icing on the cake of a great weekend, and we will stay at the Doubletree again when we are in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay with some very nice people!

reviews.text: I arrived at this Doubletree at 7 in the morning, fresh off a red eye from Boston, exhausted and disoriented from my transatlantic flight. With check-in time being mid-afternoon, I had hoped to drop my bag in a luggage room, spend my first day abroad deliriously tired, before retreating back to my room for a 3pm nap and shower.
reviews.title: A top hotel in an unbeatable location

reviews.text: The hotel staff checked my reservation, saw that my room was not ready, and transferred my room assignment to an available room, having me checked-in and napping in my ludicrously comfortable bed by 7:30, approximately eight hours before the posted check-in time. All the staff members I interacted with during my three night stay were uniformly fantastic. The customer service I experienced was unparalleled.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: The location could not be better, about five minutes from Centraal Station, just barely set aside from the occasional insanity of downtown Amsterdam, but close enough to jump in at a moments notice. My top floor room afforded fantastic views of the city, and I had no problems with the noise levels from the adjacent top floor night club.
reviews.title: Great hotel...with caveats

reviews.text: I skipped the breakfast offer (a little pricey for my blood), but the Starbucks off the lobby was convenient for morning coffees and general pick me ups. The room service pizza was tasty, but the Heineken I ordered to accompany it came in a mini-sized bottle. While this is a minor complaint, it did feel a bit deceitful, as there was no disclaimer on the menu regarding the size of the beer and the price was certainly indicative of a full sized bottle.
reviews.title: Great central location, good value

reviews.text: The Doubletree offered us a very convenient location to get anywhere. It is right next to Central Station - the hub for all transportation in, out and around Amsterdam. The guest services were knowledgable, helpful and offered purchases of museum passes right there. The hotel is clean and stylish. The only downside was the room did not have adequate space to unpack and therefore the open suitcases were always in the way.
reviews.title: 4 nights in Amsterdam

reviews.text: Stayed in this Hotel July '13 with a friend. The hotel is at the epicenter of Amsterdam, a short walk from Centraal Station. For a European hotel room, I was pleased with the size and amenities. The staff spoke great english (as with most people in Amsterdam), there are complimentary computers in the Lobby, and the wifi is excellent.
reviews.title: Great Experience! Excellent View!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooftop bar and viewpoint provides the best picture opportunity in Amsterdam. Truly, you can see the entire city while you enjoy a cocktail.
reviews.title: A Room With a View

reviews.text: Further, we were able to enjoy the free Happy Hour from 7-9pm. All you can drink wine/beer and snacks. Inquire about this, it is well worth it.
reviews.title: A great stay - especially with a city view

reviews.text: Stayed here twice in the past year. Each time was upgraded to a suite due to Hilton Honors status. Not cheap by any means, but the rooms overlooking the city have a great view. Very conveniently situated beside Centraal train station.
reviews.title: Great City & location for business

reviews.text: I was in Amsterdam for an overnight stay and I chose this hotel because of its location and good reviews on TA. I was not disappointed. It's a 5 minute walk from the Amsterdam Centraal Train station. As you walk out of the Centraal station, just turn left (east), cross one or two streets and you are there. No need for taxis or shuttles.
reviews.title: Great location for first time or repeat visitors to Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are going to Amsterdam via Schiphol Airport, you can purchase the tickets and take the train from the airport terminal. I paid 8.80 euros for roundtrip tickets (4.40 euros each way). They charge an extra 50 cents if you pay with a credit card. The trains were running every half hour on the night of my arrival. I've been told that they run every 15 minutes during peak hours.
reviews.title: 3 Night Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a 20 minute ride and Amsterdam Centaal station is the 4th stop from the airport. Stops are clearly marked and announcements are made prior to each stop in Dutch and English.
reviews.title: Busy hotel, service is a letdown

reviews.text: Here is a link for more info about Schiphol airport and the trains:
reviews.title: Great location, pretty good hotel staff

reviews.text: http://www.schiphol.nl/Travellers/ToFromSchiphol/PublicTransport/ByTrainDomestic.htm
reviews.title: Good Value for Money
Great hotel!
reviews.text: A new hotel, located near the central station of amsterdam (central location).
The room was spacious, with a wonderful view of the canal and the city. Comfort bed, soft linen and an imac in the room, also can be a TV.
reviews.title: Great stay for Queens Birthday

reviews.text: The service was good. The breakfast is rich with several types of fresh juices and a lot more.
reviews.title: Amsterdam Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also bought a ticket for the RIjksmuseum (the famous art museum) and didn't have to wait there in the line to buy the ticket.
reviews.title: great location
Great hotel!
reviews.text: I highly recommend.

Generally excellent experience of staying three nights in the junior suite. The room is clean and comfortable with a good spread of mini bar and free wifi and excellent view of the city. Impressed with the new iMAC TV screen. Shower was clean and the water pressure was very good. We liked the good spread of breakfast. Generally the staff are friendly and customer focussed. However, despite our early booking of our junior suite and we arrived just after the check-in time, we were disappointed that we had to wait for more than 2 hours to enter the room. We were also disappointed at the attitude of a male reception staff who did not show any empathy with regard to this matter. We also did not get the daily papers although promised.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent just one night here before we moved on to Paris and the rest of our vacation and we were thoroughly impressed!
reviews.title: Perfection in Amsterdam!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the email replies from Git van de Wal, to the check in and finding complimentary Prosecco for our special occasion, we would recommend this hotel and its staff without a doubt! Thank you for our wonderful stay and we will definitely stay here when we visit Amsterdam again.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel in a lovely city

reviews.text: The location is just around the corner from the train station and near to all areas of the city by easy walking.
reviews.title: Great Location.

reviews.text: If you are looking for easy access and a clean and safe hotel this is your place. Modern rooms with fast wifi and iMacs are a bonus. Surprisingly the windows do a good job in keeping out the train noise.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: Starting with checkin, this hotel impressed us. The bellhop was right there at the taxi, then promptly took our bags to the room, explaining features along the way and offering further assistance with reservations for later in the evening. Our room included breakfast which was a full buffet of eggs, assorted meats, breads, waffles with syrups and sauces, fruits, nuts, coffee, teas, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent Location with Canal View near Train Station, Great Breakfast,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After breakfast, it is a short walk to the train or just keep walking right into the heart of what's happening. Amsterdam is very walk-able. Locals and even many tourists ride bikes everywhere. The hotel is in a safe area and we found that going out in the evening was just as easy as during the day--on foot. The only time we choose to taxi was to the airport although many take the train directly from this hotel to the airport. Actually, I think this hotel is probably the closest to the train but I cannot handle my own bags.
reviews.title: first choice in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again. Clean, great location, internet, food, lounge, daily newspaper, and great hosts!
reviews.title: Conveniently positioned hotel

reviews.text: having lived in Amsterdam many years ago, we go back for weekendbreaks on a regular basis.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here on business last week. A large number of rooms look out onto the railway lines of Centraal Station which is a few hundred yards away. I had one of those and was woken early. It must have been at about 5am that the first trains start to pull in and, despite the soundproofing, the disturbance was enough to wake me. A colleague stayed in a room with a city view and had no problems. So, try to avoid a room on the railway side.
reviews.title: Avoid rooms facing the railway lines

reviews.text: Looking at other aspects of the hotel I agree with other commentators that the staff are good and the Macs are a nice touch. But I don't think this is a particularly great location. You are a 20 minute walk, in the wrong direction from the centre (Dam) and there are far better locations for the same price (aim for the Canal belt).
reviews.title: A Must stay for a weekend break in Amsterdam

reviews.text: All in all this is a business hotel and it's perfectly fine (if expensive) in that role. But, if you want a better location with great comfort in this wonderful city there are better options in my opinion.
reviews.title: Good location, average everything else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Weekend break at the Doubletree by Hilton Hotel. The staff and service received is first class. Hotel is in an excellent location within walking distance to all the sights. The staff in the sky lounge were so friendly and helpful and booked us tickets for Anne Franks House. The breakfast was amazing and for four ladies on a weekend break we had an amazing time. Would definitely go back. Amsterstam is a great city and we felt totatally safe walking around at night even quite late.
reviews.title: Great Location -Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night for business. Checked in at about 16:00 but was told my room was still being cleaned, and given the choice between waiting or upgrading to an Executive room for 30 Euro extra. Since I was in a hurry and had no time to wait I chose the upgrade, which included breakfast and complimentary minibar. This felt like an acceptable value but still, usually when my booked room is not yet available after the normal earliest check-in time of 15:00 I have been put in another room at no additional cost. The 'forced' upgrade felt a bit like trying to squeeze some more money out of a customer. By the way, don't get to excited by the free minibar because it only contains two bottles of water, two beers and a can of coke.
reviews.title: Great location great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Amsterdam and we had no idea where to stay, The Doubletree is a perfect location, a short 5 minute walk from the central train station and just a couple of minute walk to the heart of Amsterdam and it's attractions. Staff was very friendly and helpful with all our questions and needs, Only complaint was the bedding not very comfortable.
reviews.title: perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. The busy staff was always attentive to our questions. The lobby is small and mornings can be quite hectic, but the staff handles it with aplomb. While the food at the restaurant is delicious, the service is wanting. The downstairs bar -- with almost the same menu -- was better and just as nice. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: busy hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: GREAT bed!
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in perfect location
Excellent
reviews.text: Marvelous lodgings (and restaurant) immediately adjoining Amsterdam Centraal Station. You may easily walk here from the trains or airport shuttle in under 5 minutes pulling luggage.
The rooms are spacious and well appointed, perhaps a bit modern for my taste but it works.
reviews.title: good location poor service

reviews.text: No complaints no wow points.
reviews.title: Convenient location by station

reviews.text: A very practice location and clean hotel. Close to the centre of Amsterdam and next door to rail station.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lacking in any atmosphere, bit of a Holiday inn in feel.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The roof bar is fun with good views .... Staff are veery friendly
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for one night at the start of November and was travelling with family members and friends.
reviews.title: Great location, average hotel

reviews.text: my friend wanted a good cocktail and this bar at the Hilton was recommended. It was a fun scene with a big great view of the city, lots of upscale customers, an outdoor terrace, and a DJ with good music. Drinks were expensive, but the atmosphere was sophisticated.
reviews.title: I was only in the bar

reviews.text: We stayed here after our Viking River Cruise. Hotel was within walking distance from where the boat berthed. Arrival cookies were a nice touch, not that we needed them after all the food on the boat. Staff were very friendly as we checked in. Breakfast was included in the price, and had everything that you would want for breakfast.
reviews.title: "perfect location"

reviews.text: Hotel is situated close to everything, and are very helpful in booking attractions etc. Short walk to Central Train Station.
reviews.title: Left out of Centraal, moderne, floating

reviews.text: This hotel is a ledt turn out of Centraal station and 300 m walk. Its opposite the floating chinese restaurant, Sea Palace. Rooms Ok, access to excutive club a bonus. good gym, pool not tried. Onsite Starbucks and City Cafe for nice dining. For service and charm, the Amstel it is not but it is comfortable and well positioned.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Repeat: yes
reviews.title: Great Hotel in convient location
Great location. Small rooms
reviews.text: All very convenient. Great for seeing everything the city has to offer. Rooms well appointed but a bit dull with blank walls and little in the way of imagination. Beds reasonably comfy. Rooms do seem rather small for a hotel of this rating. With furniture there's no space anywhere. Only shower and no baths. Sometimes you need a bath after a long day sight seeing. Breakfast impressive, well organised and very tasty. A wee bit pricey when compared to others.

Stayed in this hotel with a bunch of friends for 4 nights. We felt kind of out of place, since it looked like the crowd there was mainly business type. The hotel is very modern, our room had a Mac desktop with a free wi-fi. The bathroom and room were large and convenient. Our room had a river view. Breakfast was really good and had a nice variety. Sky bar is recommended. Location is excellent, near the central station. Would definitely recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: A very modern hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my partner for his 30th last weekend, its a 3 minute walk from station which is ideal as we managed to check in early (staff were so friendly and helpful) then go off to Dam Square to walk round, this was also within walking distance.
reviews.title: Amazing Location,staff & hotel

reviews.text: I booked a room with a balcony which had the most amazing view. No bath but the shower was a power shower and very nice. The room had a mac pc/tv which was a nice size as i thought it may be small and was very handy as we looked up places to go on the internet (free).
reviews.title: Why so few rooms with bathtubs?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cant fault this hotel, ok maybe the bacon & sausages could of been cooked a bit more as i like it crispy but the choice of food is amazing , with freshly squeezed orange juice, muffins, pancakes, fruit, everything you can think of.
reviews.title: Thank you for making my 50th birthday special

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for two nights on a recent trip to Amsterdam. Great room with a fabulous view of the city. The breakfast was very good. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I found the location to be great for accessing transportation as well as for walking around the city. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Good location
Great location
reviews.text: Very good hotel in a good location. Across from the train station and in the harbor area. Rooms were very modern and service was good. Bar on top of hotel has wonderful view but service is somewhat slow because it is usually a popular place, Food was also good. Check in and out was fast - as was the luggage delivery. Good location for business and tourist but can get quite busy.

Situated only a short walk from central station and very convenient for walking to many attractions. Wonderful views from the 11th floor Skylounge where we had breakfast each morning. Most of the staff were friendly and the service good. There is free wi-fi throughout the hotel and free use of computers in the reception area.
reviews.title: a bit lost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights with my partner in a king city suite on the top floor over looking the canal and the whole of Amsterdam city and my stay was brilliant to say the least. the staff were so friendly and helpfull and made our stay a perfect one. The in-house food was absolutly beautiful, including the breakfast were there was so much to choose from and the quality of food was amazing. Of an evening we would go on up to the Skylounge and enjoy some cocktails or bottle of wine and enjoyed the view, the music and the feel-good vibe. The hotel is perfectly located, right by the city center and all the important sites but at the same time its situated across the canal so you still feel 'away from it all' which was nice. Over all, if u have a bit of money to splash out on a fancey weekend away i would strongly advise this place. you will not be dissapointed.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: Excellent stay in a new, clean, comfortable, centrally located hotel. Warm welcome with a fresh cookie. Starbucks inside the hotel. Excellent breakfast buffet, warm staff with a professional management of Dimitrios. Thanks, will definitely visit again !
reviews.title: Excellent stay !

reviews.text: I stayed three nights there traveling for business. For those purposes it is very good. Located just by Amsterdam Centraal is very convenient to reach easily any important site.
reviews.title: Be aware

reviews.text: However, the hotel is located just above train tracks, so one side is always exposed to noise coming from trains. I was given a room on this side of the hotel, but immediately realized that it will be noisy...When complained, I was given quite room on the other side. When traveling for business, the most important thing for me is to sleep well and all other features are really less important. If I pay 200 EUR for a nigh, then I expect at least to sleep well. Other thing that bothered me was the heating. It was quite cold outside and I couldn't set the central heating to make my room warm enough for me. (at least for my perception of warm room). However, this is often a problem with central heating systems in hotels.
reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: All other things are really ok and on the level of Hilton brand. (specially very comfortable beds) I would really emphasise very friendly and helpful staff.

Get a room with a balcony, room 833 has the corner view and it's awesome. The rooms are small and plain, the bathroom is big, staff is alright, the view from the balcony would bring us back for a second visit. It's easy to get in and out of downtown and it's quiet at night
reviews.title: Hotel eh, view awesome!

reviews.text: While the staff was exceptional and the look of the hotel was modern and conveniently located the room was not up to standard. There was little, if any, soundproofing. Given that the hotel sits beside the train tracks this should be a priority - have not had this issue with the Hilton at the airport. When I sat on the bed the entire bed shifted a good 3 inches and I ended up on the floor. I doubt I will stay here again.
reviews.title: Mixed Experience

reviews.text: We chose this hotel for its location and availability; I was in town for a major convention and we booked late, so many of the prime properties in Amsterdam were either unavailable or ridiculously expensive. The location is convenient for getting to and from the airport and anyplace else the trams go, though the entrance to the hotel is at the far end of the building from the Central Station. During the day this is no problem because you can enter through the Starbucks at the near end of the building, but at night in the rain it's a pain. The other downside is that you've got a bit of a hike past the construction for the new Metro line and across the bridge to get to any of the downtown restaurants or shops. Again, not a problem on a nice day, but with Amsterdam's frequent showers it can get old quickly.
reviews.title: Very good but not great

reviews.text: The rooms are decent but small by American standards. Ours overlooked the tracks and the harbor. I like trains, so that was no problem, but the windows in the rooms on this side of the hotel have an extra layer of glazing for noise reduction and as a consequence don't open. The ones on the city side of the hotel have operable windows. If you book, make sure you aren't assigned a room on the courtyard; it's no more than ten meters wide, so you have no privacy and no scenery.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, Dire check in/check out delays.

reviews.text: We did not visit either the restaurant or the top floor bar; we though they were both overpriced. We did visit the lobby bar for breakfast, which was a bargain for a hotel. Two cups of tea and two pain au chocolat set us back less than 10 Euros. Another alternative is the Starbucks on the ground floor.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.text: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the doubletree and cannot wait to go back. The staff from front desk, room service, housekeeping, restaurant and sky lounge were friendly and approachable and took an interest in us and did not make us feel lesser guests even when they had 3 huge conventions in the hotel. The duty manager was also a great credit to the hotel and always stopped to great guests. We have never had such great service. Room was fantastic and location is absolutely perfect with the centre only 5 mins walk away. Freshly baked cookies are given to guests when checking in and a warm farewell given when checking out. The sky lounge is stunning with the best view of the city during day or night. It's worth it just for that view but our stay was just perfect from start to finish, highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Staff made us feel like we were the only guests! Amazing service

reviews.text: The hotel is right next to central station and you can walk just about anywhere in the city, with the canal tours a hop skip and jump away and the airport 15 mins on the train - which is fantastic. The hotel itself is very very expensive as is amsterdam , service was slow and room servicing was poor - i.e. dirty glasses left in room following morning service. The restaurant I used only once for breakfast and it was ok and good choice - but all self service - so not really 4 star in my opinion. we did get free wifi and we ordered a cab one night via guest services which failed to show - so the hotel re-ordered - provided a round of drinks and picked up the bill for the cab - so that was a nice gesture. I would stay again but they need to reduce the costs and improve the service. The rooms were fine - not very big but did the job of a hotel room.
reviews.title: Great Location - but service is lack lustre

reviews.text: Very convenient location but inconsistency in service.. The front desk service was amazing but after that, things went in the other direction. The AC was not cooling, I have complained once i arrived, they have sent someone who advised to shut it off and wait 10 mins, then try again, i did what he asked for, but of course the same results.. I have called again, but the answer was that the engineer left and better if open the window. That was the day i arrived and for two days, no one bothered to follow up or call again. If will be back, just for the location as its only 5 mins walk from Amsterdam central station and very close to most of the attractions.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the reasons my partner and I travel to Europe.........
reviews.title: City Cafe/Restaurant

reviews.text: Without a doubt one of the best restaurants I have ever had the pleasure of dinning in.
reviews.title: Great hotel great location

reviews.text: i Choose this hotel for the location .it is nice for me but little cold in august for me .Hotel Have big windows that is why it comes to me cold .For me not to much problem but in winter ...? i donnot know .Hotel offer cokkies on your check in .it is so nice for me .Good luck and have a more guest
reviews.title: Near Central Station
Party until 3 am whether you want to or not
reviews.text: Doesn't matter how nice the hotel is, if you can't sleep, it's not worth a penny. We got to our room at 10:30 pm and could hear rhythmic thumping and screaming drunks from the Skylounge upstairs. Ok not bad, you think. But it got progressively louder + soon we could hear the lead singer and sing along. (Not!) At 2:00 I called the desk to complain and was offered an apology and some ear plugs. No change to the volume. It finally ended at 2:45 am. By this time we're wide awake. We had to be up at 7:30--No sleep for us tonight.

If arriving by train this hotel is in a prefect location so you can avoid the taxi ride to your hotel. You can then walk everywhere. Hotel is modern and comfortable . Our only niggles were that paper cups were provided for in -room hot drinks with a note saying that porcelain cups would be provided on request. We requested these to make a cup of tea and they never arrived. It should not be too much to ask to have a proper cup provided without having to ask and wait.
reviews.title: Great location for the station

reviews.text: We also asked for a recommendation for a dinner booking for a Rjsttafel and we found the place very touristy- we should have stuck to the Trip Advisor recommendations.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: This is a good location. Very near to Centraal station where the life is all around till late nights. Hotel is staff is very friendly and they also understand all Hilton Value for money concept. I am really impressed by this place.
reviews.title: Decent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed the 1st and 2nd of Feb. Hotel is situated 3mins from centraal station close enough to walk to shopping district or red light light district in less than 10 mins. Rooms are simple but elegant, and come with iMac Computer. Toilet/Shower is best out of all hotels stayed in. Cookie on arrival was delicious. Perhaps guests should be told where tea/coffee making facilities are as we only found out on the last day.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed to ourselves but ventured to the top of the building to the sky lounge, which is expensive but definitely worth a drink for views! Receptionists are very professional and helpful.
reviews.title: Great location, lovely design and decor - Just the heating a little off

reviews.text: Left baggage at complementary baggage storage area, as had a late flight.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a great hotel in a great location, can't recommend enough!
reviews.title: Perfect location for Amsterdam

reviews.text: (Tip: Sea Palace Chinese restaurant is two mins from hotel and worth every cent if you fancy a great meal overlooking Canal)
reviews.title: Have had better experiences at a 2-star

description: Right next to Central Station and within the historic city centre, is the impressive, newly-built DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station. The rooms and suites at the DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station feature a variety of facilities to make your stay as comfortable as possible such as individually controlled air conditioning, windows that open, and an iMac system which functions both as a TV and computer. High-speed internet access and Wi-Fi is also available free of charge throughout the entire hotel.
